radiographic_examinations.findings: Minimal bibasilar atelectasis. The liver shows multiple subcentimeter hypodensities. No evidence of intrahepatic or extrahepatic biliary dilatation. Gallbladder is surgically absent. Normal pancreas, spleen, adrenal glands, kidneys, stomach, and urinary bladder. Thickened, dilated appendix with surrounding soft tissue inflammation and small foci of hypodensity concerning for microperforation. Reactive thickening of the base of cecum. No retroperitoneal or mesenteric lymphadenopathy. No evidence of abdominal aortic aneurysm. Moderate degenerative changes seen in the lumbar spine. No evidence of worrisome osseous lesions or acute fracture.
